sen.j: 江戸時代になると江戸幕府により大奥の女性の服装に規定が定められ、他大名家においてもこの慣例に倣うようになった。
sen.e: In the Edo period, Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) laid down the regulations on costumes of the women in O-oku (the inner halls of Edo-jo Castle where the wife of the Shogun and her servants reside), and the other Daimyo families (feudal lord families) came to follow this convention, too.

sen.j: それによる「腰巻」とは、着用期間は旧暦5月5日～9月8日、地色は黒で、「提帯（さげおび）」という特殊な帯に袖を引っかけて着用した。
sen.e: According to the regulations, "koshimaki" should be as follows: the term of wearing it was May 5 - September 8 (in old lunar calendar); the background color was black; when one wore it, she hung the sode (the sleeves of the kimono) with a special obi (kimono sash) called "sageobi."
